body_html: @aluo-x Yes, that's the reason why. I think the anaconda version of MKL files (at least in Windows) are only used for using it and extending the libraries using it, but not for building the libraries relies on it. In MKL 2017, there is even no library files included in the Anaconda mkl package. Please download the full version of MKL here.

body: @aluo-x Yes, that's the reason why. I think the anaconda version of MKL files (at least in Windows) are only used for using it and extending the libraries using it, but not for building the libraries relies on it. In MKL 2017, there is even no library files included in the Anaconda mkl package. Please download the full version of MKL [here](https://software.intel.com/en-us/mkl).
